channel.title: Probability on EduGovNet.com
channel.description: Recent content in Probability on EduGovNet.com

item.title: More on Sorting and Analyzing Run Time Complexity
item.description: In the previous entry (Sorting, Random Permutations, and little bit of Probability), we introduced quick_sort, gave a version of it in C++ and started to analyze how many steps it takes to sort a vector of floating point numbers. In this entry, we continue that analysis and prove some results that will help us get a feel for other recursive algorithms.

item.title: Sorting Random Permutations and a Little Bit of Probability
item.description: In this article, we’re going to discuss a shuffling algorithm, and then quick_sort – a sorting algorithm.
